concept.title: Phrases and Blocks
concept.shortdesc: DITA domain elements can be classified into block elements and phrase elements.

conbody.p: In XML document mark-up languages, including DITA and XHTML, there are typically two types of content mark-up elements: block (or paragraph) elements, and phrase (or inline) elements.
Phrases are spans of text within a larger block of text, such as words within a paragraph. Typical phrase elements are term (term), code phrase (codeph), quotation (q), and syntax phrase (synph).

Blocks are paragraph-like elements, which are normally displayed with spacing above and below the block. Typical block elements are paragraph (p), code block (codeblock), long quotation (lq), and note (note).
